IS445(AOG) - Data Viz

IS445(AOG) - Data Viz

This is the course website for Data Visualization, instructed by Jill P. Naiman (jnaiman@illinois.edu).

Below, you will find the materials for each week, as well as a syllabus that includes contact information and a course outline.

Some handy references you might appreciate:

  • matplotlib tutorial
  • python tutorial
  • Effective Computation in Physics by Scopatz & Huff (available through Safari at UIUC)

Course syllabus

Weekly Lectures and Materials

  • Week 1 - Introduction
  • Week 2 - Data Storage and Operations
  • Week 3 - Holiday!
  • Week 4 - Types of Viz and Choosing Colors
  • Week 5 - Beginning interactivity
  • Week 6 - Continuing interactivity with bqplot
  • Week 7 - More with dashboards & Map Viz
  • Week 8 - Maps, maps and more maps
  • Week 9 - Iodide and Intro to Javascript
  • Week 10 - Viz Audience; More Iodide, Javascript & Vega-lite (and maybe Idyll)
  • Week 11 - Finish up with Iodide, Intro to Idyll
  • Week 12 - More with Idyll, Publishing Viz
  • Week 13 - A few more Idyll+d3 things, Starting SciViz
  • Week 14 - Holiday!
  • Week 15 - Scientific Viz & AVL Guest lecture
  • Week 16 - Network Visualization & Word clouds

Hosted on GitHub Pages using the Dinky theme
